<< shortcutor elementary functions subsindex >>

size

Size of an object.

Syntax

s = size(X)
sdim = size(X, dim)
[r, c] = size(X)
[s1, ... , sn] = size(X)

Input argument

X

a variable

dim

a variable: a positive integer to get the dimth dimension.

Output argument

s

a row vector whose elements contain the length of the corresponding dimension of X.

sdim

the length of dimension dim.

[r, c]

number of rows and columns.

[s1, ... , sn]

numbers with integer values.

Description

Examples

X = rand(3, 4, 5, 6);
size(X)
size(X, 3)
[r, c] =size(X)
[s1, s2, s3, s4] = size(X)


size(cell(4,3))

See also

length, ndims.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
